title: Crash on QSV Recording start

milestone.title: OBS Studio 30.0
milestone.description:
Items that we would like to consider for inclusion in OBS Studio 30.0.

NOTE: Items on this list are not promised to be in the listed release, just that we are considering them. This list is subject to change at any time.

body:
### Operating System Info

Ubuntu 22.04

### Other OS

PopOS

### OBS Studio Version

30.0.0-beta2

### OBS Studio Log URL

https://obsproject.com/logs/6NfDajK3QJACgmxo

### Expected Behavior

Selected QSV encode, expected recording to start using Arc GPU

### Current Behavior

When QSV settings are selected, AV1, 264 or 265, OBS closes without showing an error. In the terminal is the log linked before, and this last line not shown in the log file:
`obs: symbol lookup error: /usr//lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/obs-plugins/obs-qsv11.so: undefined symbol: MFXLoad`

### Steps to Reproduce

Testing was done on a fresh install of PopOS.
1. Install Intel GPU drivers from this link: https://dgpu-docs.intel.com/driver/installation.html#ubuntu-install-steps
```
sudo apt install bison flex intel-fw-gpu intel-gsc intel-level-zero-gpu intel-metrics-discovery intel-metrics-library level-zero libfl-dev libfl2 libigc1 libigdfcl1 libmetee libsigsegv2 libz3-4 m4 xpu-smi
sudo apt install intel-opencl-icd intel-level-zero-gpu level-zero intel-media-va-driver-non-free libmfx1 libmfxgen1 libvpl2 libegl-mesa0 libegl1-mesa libegl1-mesa-dev libgbm1 libgl1-mesa-dev libgl1-mesa-dri libglapi-mesa libgles2-mesa-dev libglx-mesa0 libigdgmm12 libxatracker2 mesa-va-drivers mesa-vdpau-drivers mesa-vulkan-drivers va-driver-all vainfo hwinfo clinfo
```

2. Install OBS beta using the PPA:
```
sudo add-apt-repository ppa:obsproject/obs-studio-unstable
sudo apt install obs-studio
```

3. Change recording settings to use QSV
4. Start recording, which causes OBS to close.

### Anything else we should know?

Not sure yet if this is just an issue with my setup, but QSV seems to work fine in ffmpeg (using jellyfin-ffmpeg6). This is the closest issue I could find to this one: https://github.com/obsproject/obs-studio/issues/9316. Would be great to get this working with an Arc card in linux, thanks
